title: Egg Butter Recipe
description: Use this unusual egg and butter spread as a sandwich filling, or as a topping for crackers or bagels.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Egg Butter 4.0 (2) 1 Review 2 Photos Use this unusual egg and butter spread as a sandwich filling, or as a topping for crackers or bagels. Submitted by epicureangela Updated on January 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 1 cup Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 eggs ½ cup butter 1 pinch cayenne pepper 6 drops Worcestershire sauce Directions Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch. Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes. Cool the eggs under cold running water. Peel, and remove yolks from white. Chop yolks; reserve whites for another use. Beat butter in a large bowl until soft and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks, cayenne pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Beat until smooth. name: epicureangela
instructions: Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch. Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes. Cool the eggs under cold running water. Peel, and remove yolks from white. Chop yolks; reserve whites for another use.;Beat butter in a large bowl until soft and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks, cayenne pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Beat until smooth.
